item.title: China Building a ‘Mega-Sized’ Consumer Economy, Premier Says
item.description: Premier Li Qiang has projected confidence that China can turn consumption into a driver for the economy, while also portraying his nation as a stabilizing force in a rapidly shifting global trade landscape.
item.dc:creator: Lucille Liu, Linda Lew

media:content.media:description: Chinese Premier Li Qiang

item.title: New Oil Geopolitics Laid Bare By Iran Conflict
item.description: Thanks to a decade-long shale boom, the US has emerged as the world’s biggest oil producer.
item.dc:creator: Grant Smith

media:content.media:description: A refinery on the South Pars Gas-Condensate field in Asalouyeh Seaport in Iran. Photographer: Saeid Arabzadeh/AFP/Getty Images

item.title: Trump Eyes Little-Tested Tactic for Next Step in Spending Clash
item.description: President Donald Trump’s budget director is preparing to escalate the administration’s fight over federal spending with a little-tested tactic to claw back money in the last days of the fiscal year.
item.dc:creator: Gregory Korte

media:content.media:description: US President Donald Trump

item.title: Calculate Your Gain Under a New SALT Cap
item.description: The state and local tax deduction, which primarily benefits wealthier Americans in high-tax areas, is one of the most disputed provisions of Trump’s tax bill.
item.dc:creator: Christopher Cannon, Cedric Sam

item.title: EU Top Diplomat Says NATO Mutual Defense Clause Is ‘Very Clear’
item.description: NATO’s Article 5 is “very, very clear” about allies’ commitment to defend one another when attacked, the European Union’s top diplomat said after Donald Trump appeared to question its meaning.
item.dc:creator: Andrea Palasciano, Oliver Crook

media:content.media:description: Kaja Kallas Photographer: Lina Selg/Bloomberg

item.title: Swiss See 10% US Tariffs to Stay After July 9 If Talks Go On
item.description: The Swiss government expects US tariffs to remain at the current rate of 10% after a 90-day grace period ends on July 9, as long as negotiations between the two countries continue.
item.dc:creator: Bastian Benrath-Wright, Paula Doenecke

media:content.media:description: Paradeplatz in Zurich. Photographer: Stefan Wermuth/Bloomberg

item.title: Ex-President’s Funeral Stalled as Zambia, Family Feud in Court
item.description: Zambia asked a South African court to halt the planned burial of ex-President Edgar Lungu, who died June 5, ratcheting up a feud between the current head of state and the former leader’s family.
item.dc:creator: Taonga Mitimingi, Matthew Hill

media:content.media:description: Edgar Lungu

item.title: Trump Disputes Pentagon View, Says Iran Atomic Sites ‘Destroyed’
item.description: US President Donald Trump disputed an intelligence report that found the airstrikes he ordered on Iran had only a limited impact on its nuclear program, even though the assessment came from the Pentagon.
item.dc:creator: Anthony Capaccio, Alex Wickham, Natalia Drozdiak

item.title: Trump Hails NATO Spending Plan, Says With Them ‘All The Way’
item.description: President Donald Trump expressed support for NATO, praising its moves to bolster defense spending as the pact’s leaders look to secure a US commitment to the alliance.
item.dc:creator: Stephanie Lai, Josh Wingrove

media:content.media:description: Donald Trump, right, and Mark Rutte on June 25. Photographer: Alex Brandon/AP Photo

item.title: Bipartisan Policy Center Sees Debt-Limit X-Date Soon as Aug. 15
item.description: A closely watched independent think tank has updated its estimate for when the federal government risks running out of sufficient funds to pay its obligations on time if Congress fails to suspend or lift the nation’s debt limit.
item.dc:creator: Jarrell Dillard

media:content.media:description: The US Treasury building in Washington, DC, US, on Tuesday, Dec. 31, 2024. The US Treasury Department was hacked by a Chinese state-sponsored actor through a third-party software service provider, according to a letter the agency sent to Congress on Monday. Photographer: Samuel Corum/Bloomberg

item.title: China Makes Pitch for More Private Cash in Cross-Border Projects
item.description: China’s Finance Minister Lan Fo’an has urged a greater role for private investment in ensuring sustainable funding for cross-border infrastructure, warning that emerging countries are running short of money to spend on development.
item.dc:creator: Fran Wang

media:content.media:description: China’s Finance Minister Lan Fo’an.

item.title: Switzerland Seeks Defense Cooperation With EU in New Talks
item.description: Switzerland wants to start exploratory talks on a defense partnership with the European Union as worries about a US retreat from the continent prompt a rethink of security policy in the traditionally neutral country.
item.dc:creator: Bastian Benrath-Wright

media:content.media:description: Swiss soldiers.

item.title: EU Wants China to Fix Rare Earths Issue Before July Summit
item.description: The European Union wants China to resolve the export issue around rare earth magnets before a meeting of their leaders next month, according to the bloc’s top envoy to Beijing.
item.dc:creator: James Mayger

media:content.media:description: Neodymium in Inner Mongolia. Photographer: Nelson Ching/

item.title: Israel and Iran Both Claim Wins as Trump-Brokered Truce Holds
item.description: A fragile ceasefire between Israel and Iran that the US brokered after 12 days of fighting appeared to be holding on Wednesday, with both sides claiming victory in the war.
item.dc:creator: Ethan Bronner, Leen Al-Rashdan

media:content.media:description: Workers clear debris at the site of an Iranian strike in Beersheba, Israel, On June 24. Photographer: Erik Marmor/Getty Images

item.title: Kenya Barricades Parliament on Anniversary of Deadly Protest
item.description: Kenyan security forces blocked roads leading to parliament and the president’s office in the capital as thousands of protesters gathered in the city center to mark the first anniversary of anti-government demonstrations in which dozens of people died.
item.dc:creator: David Herbling

media:content.media:description: A man waves a Kenyan flag as demonstrators march in downtown Nairobi on June 25. Photographer: LUIS TATO/AFP

item.title: NATO Leaders Play Down Concern Over Trump’s Defense Commitment
item.description: NATO leaders sought to project confidence that the US will defend allies after President Donald Trump fueled doubts about his administration’s continued commitment to crucial collective obligations.
item.dc:creator: Andrea Palasciano

media:content.media:description: US President Donald Trump

item.title: France’s Government Gets a Lifeline From Le Pen’s Far-Right
item.description: France’s minority government is set to survive a no-confidence vote over pensions as Marine Le Pen’s National Rally party reiterated its plans to abstain.
item.dc:creator: William Horobin, James Hirai

media:content.media:description: Marine Le Pen

item.title: Japan Protests New Chinese Construction in East China Sea
item.description: China has stepped up construction of drilling rigs and other platforms off its east coast to tap into maritime resources such as natural gas and fish, raising the ire of Japan and South Korea and fanning fresh concerns about Beijing’s regional ambitions.
item.dc:creator: Alastair Gale, Sakura Murakami

media:content.media:description: Photo by Jam Sta Rosa/AFP via Getty Images Photographer: JAM STA ROSA/AFP

item.title: China Tells Brazil Xi Jinping Will Miss BRICS Summit in Rio
item.description: President Xi Jinping will miss a meeting of BRICS leaders in Rio de Janeiro, according to a Brazilian official familiar with the matter, marking the first time the Chinese leader has skipped the summit since taking power.
item.dc:creator: Simone Iglesias

media:content.media:description: Chinese President Xi Jinping NHAC NGUYEN / POOL / AFP/Getty Images Photographer: NHAC NGUYEN/Getty Images

item.title: UK to Buy Nuclear-Capable F-35s Amid Trump Threats to Pull Back
item.description: The UK will buy at least a dozen new US-made F-35 fighter jets capable of carrying nuclear weapons, as Prime Minister Keir Starmer seeks to curry favor with President Donald Trump while hedging against a pull-back in American security support.
item.dc:creator: Alex Wickham

media:content.media:description: A US Air Force Lockheed Martin F-35A Lightning II military jet air display at the Paris Air Show in Paris, France, on Monday, June 16, 2025. The 55th Paris Air Show runs 16-20 June at Le Bourget airport.

item.title: Trump Baffles With Sudden U-Turn on China Buying Iranian Oil
item.description: President Donald Trump on Tuesday appeared to undermine years of US sanctions on Iran, giving its biggest customer China the green light to carry on buying its oil as he seeks to bolster a ceasefire with Israel.
item.dc:creator: Grant Smith, Ben Bartenstein, Daniel Flatley, Mia Gindis

item.title: Trump-Inspired ‘Israel Edition’ Coin Pushed During Iran Conflict
item.description: The email hit inboxes on Monday, a tense period after US attacks against Iranian nuclear sites, but before President Donald Trump announced a ceasefire in the war between Israel and Iran.
item.dc:creator: Annie Massa

media:content.media:description: An archived version of the God Bless The USA Bible webpage offering the Trump Coin Israel Edition.

item.title: Singapore PM Touts Good Ties With US, China Amid Trade Tensions
item.description: Singapore Prime Minister Lawrence Wong emphasized his country’s commitment to maintaining close ties with both the US and China, even as rivalry between the two superpowers continues to rattle global stability.
item.dc:creator: Lucille Liu

media:content.media:description: Lawrence Wong during the World Economic Forum Annual Meeting of the New Champions (AMNC25) in Tianjin on June 25.

item.title: China Doesn’t Hold Upper Hand Against US, Biden Official Says
item.description: It will take “a generation” to diversify some of the US dependency on China for rare earths and other pieces of global supply chains, but that doesn’t mean Beijing holds the economic upper hand over Washington, former US Deputy Secretary of State Kurt Campbell said.
item.dc:creator: Alastair Gale, Haslinda Amin

media:content.media:description: Kurt Campbell

item.title: EU Warns a Baseline Trump Tariff Would Still Spur Retaliation
item.description: The European Union plans to impose retaliatory tariffs on US imports, including on Boeing Co. aircraft, if President Donald Trump puts a baseline levy on the bloc’s goods as many expect.
item.dc:creator: Jorge Valero

media:content.media:description: The headquarters of the European Central Bank beyond a freight terminal in Frankfurt. Photographer: Alex Kraus/Bloomberg

item.title: Cuerpo Says Spain Defense Spending Is Enough to Meet NATO Needs
item.description: Spain’s Economy Minister Carlos Cuerpo has said the country will increase its defense expenditure as much as necessary to achieve NATO capability goals, but is sticking to its resistance to a goal of 5% of GDP.
item.dc:creator: Macarena Munoz Montijano, Kriti Gupta, Guy Johnson

item.title: NATO Tries to Use Charm to Keep Trump On Its Side
item.description: Donald Trump ensured that NATO’s high-stakes summit would be a nervy affair to the end as he arrived in The Hague fueling doubts about whether the US remains fully committed to defending its allies.
item.dc:creator: Andrea Palasciano, Stephanie Lai, Ania Nussbaum

media:content.media:description: US President Donald Trump arrives for a dinner at Huis ten Bosch Palace during the 2025 NATO Summit in The Hague, Netherlands, on June 24, 2025.

item.title: Mamdani Stuns in NYC Mayoral Primary Race
item.description: Former New York Governor Andrew Cuomo conceded to his upstart rival Zohran Mamdani in the Democratic primary in the race to become mayor of New York City after the 33-year-old Queens lawmaker racked up commanding leads across Brooklyn, Queens and Manhattan.
item.dc:creator: Laura Nahmias, Nacha Cattan, Gregory Korte

media:content.media:description: Zohran Mamdani during an election night event in New York, on June 25. Photographer: Christian Monterrosa/Bloomberg

item.title: Indonesia’s Finance Chief Reassures Investors on Fiscal Discipline in Prabowo Era
item.description: Indonesia’s finance minister presented a unified front with President Prabowo Subianto, stressing that the government is committed to fiscal discipline while rolling out the new leader’s priority programs. Bonds extended a rally.
item.dc:creator: Grace Sihombing, Prima Wirayani, Haslinda Amin

media:content.media:description: Sri Mulyani Indrawati Photographer: Dimas Ardian/Bloomberg Economics

item.title: European Leaders Seek to Finalize 5% Defense Commitment

media:content.media:description: US soldiers take part in a NATO exercise in Romania in June. Photographer: Daniel Mihailescu/Getty Images
